Tuesday, April 17, 2007























'Tragic rush to accuse' in Duke case
All sexual assault and kidnap charges against three men stemming from a Duke lacrosse team party were dropped today. North Carolina State Attorney General Roy Cooper said: "We believe that these cases were the result of a tragic rush to accuse and a failure to verify serious allegations." 
FULL STORY

•  Audio slide show: Duke players cleared
•  D.A. aplogizes to cleared players
•  Players might sue
•  Case raises questions about anonymous accusers


























NANCY GRACE Airs on Headline PRIME, 8 p.m. ET
"Nancy Grace" is television's only justice-themed interview and debate show. Nancy Grace challenges guests
on the most controversial and high-profile legal issues of the day by drawing on her unique perspective
as a former violent crimes prosecutor and as a crime victim herself.  Send your questions and comments.





















Pastor's daughter recounts slaying
Prosecutors rested their case against Mary Winkler, a preacher's wife accused of murdering her husband, with the heartbreaking testimony of the couple's 9-year-old daughter.
FULL STORY






'Girls Gone Wild' founder surrenders 
Joe Francis, the founder of the "Girls Gone Wild" video empire, surrendered to federal marshals early Tuesday to face a contempt of court citation after initially defying a federal judge.
FULL STORY






Teen gets 45 years for school shooting
A 15-year-old boy pleaded guilty Tuesday in the killing of a high school official and the wounding of two others under a plea deal announced after jury selection for his trial had started.
FULL STORY






Astronaut had bondage photos
A police search of former astronaut Lisa Nowak's car turned up bondage photos on a computer disk, British currency and pills, according to documents released Tuesday by prosecutors.
FULL STORY
